basic_info.description: I'm Kawika Miller - Digital artist turned software developer with a background in game design and development. I started off creating 3D assets for games and eventually started programming my own game prototypes with Unreal Engine's visual scripting system (blueprints). As I learned more about object oriented programming I realized that I really enjoyed the creative problem solving that came with programming which eventually put me on the path that I'm on now. I believe my aptitude for art, design, creative thinking and my love for tech can ultimately come together to create appealing and engaging web content for everyone. My supervisors and coworkers have praised my diligence as a worker as well as my interpersonal skills which make me a strong addition to any team. Inclusivity, equity, and progressive ideals are incredibly important to me and I want to work with other people who share those values.

projects.title: Horned Beasts
projects.description: My first project working with React! I learned a lot about passing props and state management and also got my first taste of Bootstrap all at once! It iterates through a .json file and displays a horned beast component and they can even be filtered down based on how many horns they have! You can also click on them to display a Modal component for even more information. This was equally as challenging as it was rewarding.

projects.title: Portfolio Presenter
projects.description: My first group project! Our goal was to create an all-in-one portfolio presentation app for developers. A user can take a project folder and display all the text inside of the .html, .css, and .js files side-by-side with the deployed web page. I created all of the logic responsible for displaying the project's files and deployed page to the screen, as well as the functionality behind some of the other features such as the ability to create notes and to-do lists.

projects.title: Odd Duck Products
projects.description: My second major project that focused on implementing event handlers and local storage to track data and then using Chart.js to display that information to the screen.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: One of the first apps I worked on at Code Fellows! I had to develop a mock up of a webpage for a store that sold cookies. I learned a lot about using constructors, how to display information in a table, as well as how to implement forms for various situations.
